intro: Agalinis flexicaulis, commonly known as the narrowleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite and linear, often appearing in clusters at the base of the plant. Agalinis flexicaulis is an annual herb that plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
